alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; Hall; Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 10:44AM CST until January 19 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A QUICK HIT OF SNOW THIS AFTERNOON, FOLLOWED BY LINGERING BLOWING SNOW... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory this afternoon into overnight, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to around 1 inch, but with north-northwest winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 MPH, even after snow ends. For the Wind Chill Advisory this evening into Friday morning, very cold wind chills as low as -20 to -25 expected. For the Wind Chill Watch for Friday evening into Saturday morning, dangerously cold wind chills as low as -25 to -35 possible. * WHERE...Sherman, Fillmore, and Hall Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...All falling, accumulating snow will end by around sunset, if not sooner. However,north-northwest winds will remain gusty through the night, likely causing at least minor blowing and drifting snow issues. Wind gusts will gradually drop to around 20 MPH or less by sunrise Friday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation.
